intro: Tragia interrupta, commonly known as the prickly morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the morning, followed by distinctive, spiny seed pods. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine, stiff hairs. Tragia interrupta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
